loot_defines.description: Granted only to the Order's most devout and effective followers.

loot_defines.description: I prefer sneaking to stabbing, to be honest.

loot_defines.description: You put things in and they almost immediately fall out.
loot_defines.name: Holey Bag

loot_defines.name: Sturdy Bag

news_defines.content: In Faerûn, the Running is a four day holiday during which most shops are closed and markets cancelled. Folks travel (as far as they can within those four days) to visit parents, kin, or friends for feasting, gossip, and making deals. For our intrepid band of heroes this is just enough time to take on a well-paying contract for a journey into the High Forest in search of a rare elven artifact. Complete the adventure to recruit Catti-Brie, a human fighter and our fourth Companion of the Hall! This event runs until Tuesday, May 15th, at noon PDT.
news_defines.title: New Event: The Running

news_defines.content: Today's update includes the largest number of new variants we've ever released at once! There are three new Grand Tour of the Sword Coast variants and two new Tomb of Annihilation variants, each more challenging and devious than the last. In addition, this update includes new upgrades for all Champions and more than half a dozen commonly requested quality of life fixes and features. Check out the change log for more details.
news_defines.title: New Variants and Features!

news_defines.content:
The start of spring is traditionally a day of peace and rejoicing marked by the display of flowers (even if they need to be grown in a hothouse during the winter months, or brought from southern climes) that are worn or given as sacrifices to the gods who have brought life back to the world. A group of Githyanki have other plans for the day, though.

Complete this adventure and recruit Nrakk, a Githzerai Monk. This event will run until Tuesday, April 24th at noon PDT. Good luck!
news_defines.title: New Event: Greengrass

news_defines.content:
Having survived a long, dark, cold winter, Festival of Fools participants don brightly colored and garishly patterned clothing and dance in the streets like court jesters, each competing with the others to see who can pull off the most foolish (yet generally harmless) prank(s). What could possibly go wrong with that?

This event unlocks Strix, the Trash Witch. She's a powerful caster swap for Jamilah, and should not be underestimated, regardless of her disheveled appearance. The event runs until Tuesday, April 10th at noon PDT. Good luck!
news_defines.title: New Event: Festival of Fools

news_defines.content:
Introducing Familiars! Familiars can be purchased for gems or real money and assigned to specific tasks, such as clicking enemies, leveling up champions, or using ultimates. There are six familiars available to purchase, three for gems and three via DLC. They all function the same, though. Check out the change log for more details.

Familiars unlock once you have reached area 66 in any campaign (for most existing players they will become available right away). The cheapest familiar costs 1,000 gems.
news_defines.title: New Feature: Familiars

upgrade_defines.name: Inspired
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Bruenor does more damage if he's adjacent to more companions. Place him next to as many Champions as you can.

upgrade_defines.name: Rally
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Bruenor increases the damage of Champions in the same column as him. Place him in the same column as your most damaging Champions.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Bruenor focuses on the development of his own strength and damage, dealing devastating blows to enemies.
Bruenor focuses on developing his group tactics, further increasing the damage of those in the same column as him.

upgrade_defines.name: Crusader's Mantle
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Celeste increases the damage of adjacent Champions. Place her next to your most damaging Champions.

upgrade_defines.name: Mass Cure Wounds
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Celeste heals everyone in the column in front of her. Place her behind your front-most Champions to keep them alive longer.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Celeste focuses her concentration on increasing the damage of those around her.
Celeste focuses her concentration on healing those in need of aid.

upgrade_defines.name: Aura of Courage
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Nayeli increases the damage of Champions in the column behind hers. Place her in front of your most damaging Champions.

upgrade_defines.name: Aura of Protection
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Nayeli increases your formation's damage for each enemy attacking her. Place her at the front of your formation to take advantage of this.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Nayeli focuses on rallying her fellow Champions and further increasing the damage of anyone in the column behind her.
Nayeli focuses on tanking enemies and increasing her own survivability, keeping her foes from attacking her friends.

upgrade_defines.name: Room To Work
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Jarlaxle performs best when there is nobody directly in front of him. Leave the slots directly in front of him empty to increase his damage.

upgrade_defines.name: Equal Opportunity
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Jarlaxle works best in diverse groups. Increase his damage by having at least three unique races adjacent to him.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Jarlaxle fights best with room to work. He further excels when the slots directly in front of him are empty.
Jarlaxle works best in diverse groups. He further excels when there are three or more unique races adjacent to him.

upgrade_defines.name: Bardic Inspiration
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Calliope inspires those in front of her to do more damage. Place her behind your most damaging Champions.

upgrade_defines.name: Song of Protection
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Calliope protects those near her when they are damaged. Place her within two slots of your front-line to ensure her song reaches them.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Calliope focuses her efforts on increasing the damage of those in front of her.
Calliope focuses her efforts on increasing the effectiveness of her damage shields.
Asharra forms a bond of friendship with the Human champions in your party, increasing their damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Bond: Humans
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Asharra has formed a bond of friendship with your Human champions. Focus on having those champions as your main damage dealers.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Asharra forms a bond of friendship with the Elf and Dwarf champions in your party, increasing their damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Bond: Elves and Dwarves
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Asharra has formed a bond of friendship with your Elf and Dwarf champions. Focus on having those champions as your main damage dealers.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Asharra forms a bond of friendship with the Tiefling, Firbolg, and Dragonborn champions in your party, increasing their damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Bond: Tiefling, Firbolg, and Dragonborn
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Asharra has formed a bond of friendship with your Tiefling, Firbolg, and Dragonborn champions. Focus on having those champions as your main damage dealers.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Minsc favors hunting Humanoid enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Humanoids
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Minsc has a history with Humanoid enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Humanoids.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Minsc favors hunting Bestial enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Beasts
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Minsc has a history with Beast enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Beasts.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Minsc favors hunting Undead enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Undead
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Minsc has a history with Undead enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Undead.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Minsc favors hunting Fey enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Fey
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Minsc has a history with Fey enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Fey.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Minsc favors hunting Monstrosity enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Monstrosities
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Minsc has a history with Monstrosity enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Monstrosities.

upgrade_defines.name: Twinned Spell
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Delina's attacks ricochet off of the enemy hit and damage a nearby enemy for additional damage, making her excel at clearing out small groups of enemies.

upgrade_defines.name: Empowered Spell
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Delina is a pure damage dealer. Her attacks burn enemies hit for additional damage, further increasing her damage done against them.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Delina focuses on increasing the damage her Twinned Spell does to enemies.
Delina focuses on increasing the extra damage done by her Empowered Spells.
Makos' dark pact with his fiendish patron results in monsters killed by him dropping more gold.
upgrade_defines.name: Dark Luck
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Enemies that Makos lands the killing blow on drop additional gold.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Makos' dark pact allows him to bless those who are not next to him, causing them to do more damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Dark Blessing
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Champions that are not adjacent to Makos deal additional damage. Make sure he's not adjacent to other damage dealers to increase their damage.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Tyril draws upon a beam of pure moonlight, increasing the damage of all Champions. He also gains the ability to heal those near him over time.
upgrade_defines.name: Moonbeam
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Tyril increases your party's damage, but the increase is reduced by each Champion next to him. Keep him on his own to maximize the benefit.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Tyril transforms into a bear and gains additional hit points and damage reduction abilities over time.
upgrade_defines.name: Wild Shape
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Tyril can be an excellent tank. Keep him at the front of your formation to soak up damage.

upgrade_defines.name: Druidic Healing
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Tyril heals those next to him. Place him next to your front-line tanks to help keep them alive longer.

upgrade_defines.name: Wild Resilience
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Tyril reduces damage done to himself by a certain amount each hit. Place him at the front of your formation to protect your other Champions.

upgrade_defines.name: Reckless Attack
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Jamilah deals additional damage, but takes more damage herself when hit. She should not be placed at the front of your formation.

upgrade_defines.name: Frenzy
upgrade_defines.tip_text: While attacking, Jamilah will leap to a second nearby enemy and damage it as well, making her more effective against groups of enemies.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Jamilah focuses her energy on increasing her damage done per attack, resulting in more damage per hit.
Jamilah focuses her energy on speeding up her attacks, resulting in less damaging but more frequent attacks.

upgrade_defines.name: First In Line
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Arkhan does more damage if he's on the front lines, bashing skulls and taking names. Place him at the front of your formation.

upgrade_defines.name: Loyalty
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Arkhan's health is increased if there are at least two Champions in the column behind him. Place him in such a way that there always are.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Chango, Arkhan's subservient Manticore, joins the battle, replacing Arkhan's Ultimate attack with a devastating single target attack.
Chango, Arkhan's subservient Manticore, offers his life force to Arkhan, increasing his fortitude and providing self healing abilities.

upgrade_defines.name: Spare Dagger
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Hitch somehow always has a spare dagger up his sleeve, and will toss it at a random enemy before he attacks.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Hitch always has yet another spare dagger to toss, thus increasing the number of daggers he throws before attacking.

upgrade_defines.name: Friendly
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Hitch increases the damage of Champions with high Charisma scores. Use Champions with high scores to increase their damage.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Hitch spends more time chatting with interesting people, further increasing the damage of your Champions with a high charisma score.

upgrade_defines.name: Golden Palm
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Enemies that Stoki attacks drop additional gold when killed. The more enemies she attacks, the more gold you'll get.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Stoki focuses her ki on delivering specific strikes to each enemy she attacks, increasing the damage her targets take from other champions for the next few seconds.
upgrade_defines.name: Ki Strike
upgrade_defines.tip_text: If you chose the Ki Strike specialization, enemies that Stoki attacks take additional damage from other champions for a few seconds.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Stoki focuses her ki on attacking more targets with each attack, increasing the potential number of targets affected by her ability that increases gold drops.

upgrade_defines.name: Eldritch Strike
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Enemies that Krond attacks multiple times take extra damage from his Cantrips.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Add the Thunderclap cantrip to Krond's attacks. Thunderclap deals AOE damage to all nearby enemies.
upgrade_defines.name: Cantrip: Thunderclap
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Krond casts the Thunderclap cantrip when he attacks, dealing AOE damage to all nearby enemies.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Add the Shocking Grasp cantrip to Krond's attacks. Shocking Grasp deals additional damage to Krond's primary target.
upgrade_defines.name: Cantrip: Shocking Grasp
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Krond casts the Shocking Grasp cantrip when he attacks, dealing additional damage to his primary target.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Add the Fire Bolt cantrip to Krond's attacks. Fire Bolt deals additional damage to three random enemies.
upgrade_defines.name: Cantrip: Fire Bolt
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Krond casts the Fire Bolt cantrip when he attacks, dealing additional damage to three random enemies.

upgrade_defines.name: Grandmotherly Love
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Gromma increases the damage of other champions in the formation based on their age; the younger they are, the greater the buff.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Gromma gains Stoneskin. A future upgrade will cause enemies that hit her to take extra damage.
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Gromma focuses on protecting those in the formation by reducing damage taken from ranged attackers.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Gromma now casts Sleet Storm when attacking. A future upgrade will cause affected enemies to take additional damage from all attacks.
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Gromma focuses on supporting those in the formation by reducing the effectiveness of enemies she hits.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Gromma now casts Melf's Acid Arrow as her primary attack. A future upgrade will cause it to do AOE damage as well.
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Gromma focuses on damaging the formation's enemies by using a powerful ranged spell to attack.

upgrade_defines.name: Skill Empowerment
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Dhadius's Skill Empowerment spell affects all Champions within 2 formation slots of himself. Place intelligent Champions near Dhadius to make use of his blunder.

upgrade_defines.name: Practice Makes Perfect
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Dhadius' Chromatic Orb attack does more and more damage the more times he casts the same element in a row. Can you get lucky!?

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Chromatic orbs now damage all enemies in a small radius near the enemy they hit.
Skill Empowerment increases the damage of intelligent Champions by even more.

upgrade_defines.name: Icingdeath
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Drizzt deals additional random frost damage whenever he attacks, making him an excellet damage dealer.

upgrade_defines.name: Twinkle
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Enemies damaged by Drizzt have a 50% chance to miss the next time they attack.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Drizzt's base attack now does AOE; this spec has slightly lower damage buffs than Drow Stalker
Drizzt's base attack now hits 3 times targetting the three closest enemies; this spec has slightly higher damage buffs than Whirl of Steel

upgrade_defines.name: Blessed Hammer
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Barrowin causes adjacent Champions to do additional damage whenever she attacks.

upgrade_defines.name: Healing Word
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Barrowin heals Champions in the same column as her. Place her in a column that takes a lot of damage!

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Barrowin's Blessed Hammer is more effective, causing her allies to do even more damage.
Barrowin's Healing Word is more effective, causing her to heal for even more.
Regis will increase the damage of Champions in the column directly in front of him.
upgrade_defines.name: Ruby Encouragement
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Regis increases the damage of Champions in the column in front on him. Place him directly behind your best damage dealers!

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Regis will increase the damage of Champions in the column directly behind him.
upgrade_defines.name: Ruby Encouragement
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Regis increases the damage of Champions in the column right behind him. Place him directly in front of your best damage dealers!

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Regis increases the damage taken by monsters from ranged attacks.
upgrade_defines.name: Ruby Weakness
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Regis increases the damage taken by monsters from ranged attacks. Make sure your best damage dealers attack with ranged damage!

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Regis increases the damage taken by monsters from melee attacks.
upgrade_defines.name: Ruby Weakness
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Regis increases the damage taken by monsters from melee attacks. Make sure your best damage dealers attack with melee damage!

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Regis increases the damage taken by monsters from magic attacks.
upgrade_defines.name: Ruby Weakness
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Regis increases the damage taken by monsters from magic attacks. Make sure your best damage dealers attack with magic damage!

upgrade_defines.name: Song of Battle
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Birdsong increases the damage of Champions within two slots of her. Place her near your highest damage Champions.

upgrade_defines.name: Tempo of Victory
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Birdsong's buff increases even more when she gets kills. Arrange your formation so she can effectively kill enemies.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: "Good" Champions receive twice the benefit from Song of Battle.
upgrade_defines.name: Theme of Valor

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: "Neutral" Champions receive twice the benefit from Song of Battle.
upgrade_defines.name: Theme of Consideration

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: "Evil" Champions receive twice the benefit from Song of Battle.
upgrade_defines.name: Theme of Deception

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu favors hunting Drow enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Drow
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Zorbu has a history with Drow enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Drow.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu favors hunting Fiendish enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Fiend
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Zorbu has a history with Fiendish enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Fiends.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu favors hunting Aberration enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Aberration
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Zorbu has a history with Aberration enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Aberrations.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu favors hunting Giant enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Giant
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Zorbu has a history with Giant enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Giants.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu favors hunting Elemental enemies. They take additional damage from the party.
upgrade_defines.name: Favored Enemy: Elemental
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Zorbu has a history with Elemental enemies, so with his direction the party does additional damage to any Elementals.

upgrade_defines.name: Hunter's Pack
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Zorbu increases the damage of adjacent Champions with high DEX scores. Place high DEX Champions next to Zorbu.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu focuses on dealing additional damage to already injured enemies.
upgrade_defines.name: Colossus Slayer

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Zorbu focuses on dealing additional damage to enemies who are actively attacking the formation.
upgrade_defines.name: Horde Breaker
Haunted
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Strix increases your party's damage for each ally who has been killed.

upgrade_defines.name: Poor Hygiene
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Strix causes enemies that approach your party to take additional damage.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Strix panics and attacks faster if any of her allies have recently been attacked.
Strix hides and therefore attacks a little less often, but does more damage with each attack.

upgrade_defines.name: Kensei Cleave
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Nrakk is a pure damage dealer; use all of your buffers to make him do more damage!

upgrade_defines.name: Stunning Strike
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Nrakk's damage can spike based on when certain abilities activate at the same time.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Nrakk attacks faster and deals additional damage after Stunning Strike stuns one or more enemies
upgrade_defines.name: Kensei Advantage

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: If Nrakk's attack only hits one enemy, he attacks that enemy again for additional damage
upgrade_defines.name: Unerring Accuracy

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Asharra forms a bond of friendship with any Half-Orc and Half-Elf champions in your party, increasing their damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Bond: Half-bloods
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Asharra has formed a bond of friendship with your Half-Orc and Half-Elf champions. Focus on having those champions as your main damage dealers.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Asharra forms a bond of friendship with any Githzerai and Tabaxi champions in your party, increasing their damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Bond: Exotic Races
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Asharra has formed a bond of friendship with your Githzerai and Tabaxi champions. Focus on having those champions as your main damage dealers.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Asharra forms a bond of friendship with any Gnome or Halfling champions in your party, increasing their damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Bond: Short-folk
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Asharra has formed a bond of friendship with your Gnome and Halfling champions. Focus on having those champions as your main damage dealers.

upgrade_defines.name: Critical Hit
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Catti-brie's damage comes through her Critical Hits, which she can share with others through her ultimate attack.

upgrade_defines.name: Mark for Death
upgrade_defines.tip_text: Enemies damaged by Catti-brie take additional damage from everyone and can be stunned after enough hits.

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: After scoring a critical hit, Catti-brie's next four attacks hit for 100% more damage.
upgrade_defines.name: Follow-Up

upgrade_defines.specialization_description: Increase critical hit damage bonus by 200%.
upgrade_defines.name: In The Zone

Cookies
A “cookie” is a small piece of information stored on your computer by a web page. It is used to identify you to the web server. It tells the server who you are when you return to a page on the same website. Your browser will only send a cookie back to the domain that originally sent it to you. A cookie cannot run any programs, deliver any viruses, or send back information about your system.

Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but if you do not wish to have cookies on your system, you should adjust your browser settings to decline them or to alert you when cookies are being sent. Welcome to Crusaders of the Lost Idols! This is a dangerous land filled with monsters. Help your Crusaders to be victorious.

In this game, your Crusaders march in formation towards their enemies. You will need to adjust their formation in order to get the best results. Small changes in formation can have very large impacts. You have been warned.

Your Crusaders passively deal damage over time to the closest enemy, and you can click the screen to deal additional damage.

Vanquish the monsters in order to complete quests and earn gold. In turn you spend gold to level up your Crusaders and progress to new areas and greater challenges.

Good luck!
Get Red Rubies by completing Campaign Objectives
Finger tired? Bench the Bush Whacker. Your other Crusaders can do the work!
Take a break from clicking and organize your formation for max DPS!
Crusaders on your bench are inactive! Drag them onto a slot to use them.
Click 1,000 times to get "Many Clicks" and you get a 1% boost to DPS!
Defeat a boss for the first time and get an achievement which boosts your DPS!
Crusaders on the field for 5 hours earn experience points which boost DPS!
Experience points only apply to your current play through.
Khouri's Koffee Potion ability is super powerful when he buffs your most powerful Crusaders.
Put Crusaders in the column behind Sasha to get the DPS buff from her Bulwark ability.
Artaxes increases the DPS of Crusaders in the column in front of him.
Jim increases his DPS and the DPS of all other Crusaders in his column.
The best formation may not be a full formation!
Need extra DPS? Get a Crusader to level 200 or more and buy their boost upgrade!
Every 25 levels over (and including) 200 adds 4x Multiplier to a Crusader's DPS!
Chests contain Gear for your Crusaders, plus Trinkets, Gold and Buffs for you.
Large Chests are guaranteed to have a Rare Card or better!
When you win a Small Chest, there's a chance it could be upgraded to a Large Chest!
Time Warp buffs from Large Chests give you up to 8 hours of gold in an instant!
Gold Boost buffs increase your gold drops when activated!
Power Boost buffs increase your Crusaders DPS to help get past a tricky area!
Accuracy buffs increase your chance to get Critical Damage Clicks!
Crit buffs increase the power of your Critical Clicks!
DPS is damage per second. How much do your Crusaders provide?
Find the best spot for your Bush Whacker to do the most click damage!
Click DMG (or CLK) is the damage you do with one click.
Common gear and buffs are white and found most often.
Uncommon gear and buffs are green and slightly better than common ones.
Rare gear and buffs are blue and much better than uncommon ones.
Epic gear and buffs are purple and super powerful. Open a large chest for a chance to get one!
Crusaders wear up to three pieces of gear at a time.
Better versions of gear for a Crusader automatically replace a lower rarity.
Some gear increases the DPS of all Crusaders in your formation.
Can you collect all rare and epic gear for your Crusaders?
Duplicate piece of gear? No problem. Enchantment points here we come.
Enchantment points survive through each reset just like gear.
Use Kaine's Magnify ability to boost the effect of Storm Rider or other abilities!
Want to use Firestorm? You'll need the Princess or someone in her seat in your formation!
The green arrows when dragging a Crusader show you whom their formation ability affects.
Hover the white circle near your Crusaders to see who is buffing them!
The Princess' upgrades increase the DPS of all Crusaders in your formation.
A soft reset gets you idols and unlocks campaigns.
To reset the world, you need Nate at level 150 and 500Q gold!
Extra gold in your pocket? Make sure to buy as many Crusader levels as you can before a reset!
Bosses may drop a Silver Chest, even after reset.
You can buy Large Chests with Red Rubies
The first time you ever defeat a boss you are rewarded with a Silver Chest!
The Cornucopia and Horn trinkets lower the cost of cooldowns for using abilities!
Find an Epic Diamond Ring trinket to boost DPS of all Crusaders by 8%.
Trinkets of all rarities boost your whole formation.
Gold stars will show up on new gear, buffs, trinkets and achievements so you can check it out!
Idols increase your DPS and gold drops.

Damage can be dealt in two ways: through clicking (CLK) or damage over time (DPS), which is applied automatically. These values and others can be seen in the top left UI panel.

All of your damage comes from your Crusaders. Some give CLK while the majority give DPS. To increase your damage, you must improve your Crusaders, either by leveling them up, unlocking upgrades, or finding their equipment.

New crusaders can be unlocked by simply leveling them to LVL 1.

Your Crusaders will walk in formation towards the right side of the screen. You can change their formation by clicking and dragging a Crusader from one formation slot to another. You can add and remove Crusaders from the formation by dragging them on or off the panel on the bottom of your screen (called the bench). Crusaders on the bench do not contribute any of their power or abilities.

Throughout the game, you will unlock formation abilities, each with unique applications within the formation. It's essential to optimize your formation to maximize their effects!

The game consists of a sequence of areas, broken up into regions. Region/Area information is displayed in the top right UI panel.

Each region has 4 areas and 1 boss area. Each area has a quest which will unlock the next area when completed. Boss areas are particularly tough, but you will be rewarded with a silver loot chest for completing them for the first time ever. Afterwards, they have a chance to drop on subsequent playthroughs.

You can open your loot chests in the bottom UI panel on the Item tab.

Loot chests will contain gold, buffs, or items. Buffs provide a boost to various stats for a limited time. Items include trinkets and equipment that provide stat bonuses. The rarer the loot, the greater the bonuses!

You do not need to equip equipment. Equipment intended for a specific Crusader will automatically equip to that Crusader as soon as you acquire it. You can view a Crusader's equipment in the bottom UI panel on the Crusaders tab.

Trinkets provide buffs which apply to all your Crusaders. These buffs are called global buffs. Trinkets can be viewed in the bottom UI panel on the Item tab.

You will likely reach a point in game play where your progress slows down. The game ramps up in difficulty, requiring that you do a 'Soft Reset'. You will initiate this when you unlock the Nate Dragon's upgrade: 'The End of the World'.

When you do a soft reset, your progress, Crusaders, and gold will reset to the beginning of the game. However, you will keep all of the Crusader equipment and your trinkets. As well, you will be awarded Idols, based on the number of Crusader levels you accumulated on that play through. Idols grant you bonuses to your DPS and your Gold Drop. Note: The Crusader levels are only counted for the Crusaders currently in their seats

With your increased power, you'll be able to reach higher and higher areas with each play through.

Here is a list of the hotkeys available in the game:

Shift	- Hold to allow leveling up x10 levels at a time
Ctrl	- Hold to allow leveling up x100 levels at a time
Shift+Ctrl - Hold to allow leveling up x25 levels at a time

P - Play History
G - Toggle Auto-Progression

Q - Load the saved formation in slot 1
W - Load the saved formation in slot 2
E - Load the saved formation in slot 3

Space - Dismiss all notifications

Right arrow - Proceed to next area (+shift to go to max area)
Left arrow - Retreat to previous area (+shift to go to area 1)

Crusaders earn enchantment points (EP) when you:

1) Acquire a piece of equipment for them that they already have. That equipment is disenchanted.
2) Acquire a piece of loot better than their existing loot. The old equipment is disenchanted.

When a piece of equipment is disenchanted, the Crusader it belongs to earns enchantment points based on it's rarity:

Common = 1 EP
Uncommon = 2 EP
Rare = 3 EP
Epic = 4 EP

You've got a bench slot that can be occupied by a different Crusader that you recently unlocked!

Click the new button to bring up a list of other Crusaders that can occupy this bench slot, then click 'Swap' to swap them in. Only one Crusader can be active in each bench slot at a time.
Tired of clicking the next arrow? Enable 'Auto Progression' in the options menu.

How do I play the Liars' Night Event? The Liars' Night Event is a brand new temporary campaign with a single adventure and three variants. You can start the adventures from the Campaign Map just like you would any other adventure, except that you must spend Event Tokens (Liars' Tarts) to start them. The base adventure will unlock a new Champion, and the variants and free play provide chests that can be used to gear up the Champion. When the event ends, you keep the new Champion, any gear you have aquired for them, and a gain a boost to your permanent campaign favor. How do I get more Event Tokens (Liars' Tarts)? Event Tokens will drop periodically from monsters in all adventures and campaigns. You will also receive Event Tokens along with your offline gold gains when you load the game after having been offline for a while. Finally, using Contracts during the event will award Event Tokens at a rate of 2 per minute (60 for small contracts, 480 for medium, and 960 for large). How do I use the new Champion I've unlocked? Once you complete the event's base adventure, you can swap in the new Champion you've unlocked by clicking on the portrait of whomever they swap with, then clicking the swap button the top-right corner of their portrait on their character sheet. You can only have one Champion from each bench slot in your formation at a time. How do I gear up the new Champion I've unlocked? Equipment for event champions appear in event-specific chests. They cannot receive gear from normal silver or gold chests. You can earn event chests by completing event variants, the event free play, or by purchasing them directly for Event Tokens. Why is the Divine Favor in the event different from the base campaign Divine Favor? In order to provide a more balanced experience for all players, each event has a different type of Divine Favor, which means everyone starts on relatively even footing. You still have your gear, unlocked Champions, and experience with formations to give you an advantage over newer players. What happens to my Event Divine Favor after the event ends? Once the event ends you'll have an opportunity to convert your Event Divine Favor into a different deity's Divine Favor for the campaign of your choice, so your hard earned Event Divine Favor will not go to waste. The more Divine Favor you earn in the event, the bigger the amount you earn for your permanent campaign.

How do I play the Blood Bowl Event? The Blood Bowl Event is a limited-time campaign with four objectives and free play. You must do a soft reset or abandon your current objective to play them. To do a soft reset, level Nate Dragon (the 20th Crusader) up to level 150 and use his "Reset the World" ability (if this is your first time playing that will take between 1 to 3 days on average). The first objective costs 100 Helmets to begin, so make sure you have some saved up before you reset. How do I get more Helmets? Helmets will drop from monsters at a fairly regular rate in any objective. They are also awarded based on an averaged drop rate when you use Warp cards. You can save up your Helmets and do a bunch of Blood Bowl Objectives in a row, so don't worry if you're a few days away from resetting when the event begins. I unlocked the new Crusaders, but I can't find them to put in my formation! Groklok the Ork and Drizzle the Dark Elf can replace Sasha the Fierce Warrior and Artaxes, the Lion on your bench and in your formation. Look for the swap button next to the level-up button on Sasha the Fierce Warrior and Artaxes, the Lion to swap them. You can only have one Crusader from each bench seat in your formation at once. Will the Blood Bowl Crusaders stick around after the event ends? Yes, as long as you unlock the Blood Bowl Crusaders before the event ends, you'll be able to swap them into your formation at any time. How do I get equipment for the Blood Bowl Crusaders? Equipment cards for Blood Bowl Crusaders can only be found in Blood Bowl Chests, which can be earned by completing Blood Bowl objectives, Blood Bowl free play, or by purchasing them from the store. Jeweled Blood Bowl Chests will be awarded from completing the 'Cheerleaders from Hell', 'No Hoomans Allowed', and 'Waiting for Halftime' objectives, and additional Blood Bowl Chests can be earned by doing Blood Bowl Free Play. Jeweled Blood Bowl Chests will remain available in the in-game store for 2 days following the end of the event, but you are only able to buy them for Helmets while the event is still running. What happens if the event ends while I'm still doing an Event Objective or Free Play? You will be able to finish up that event objective or free play and earn the full rewards even if you don't finish until after the event ends. This includes permanently unlocking an Event Crusader if that's the particular objective you're on.

How do I play the Festival of Fools Event? The Festival of Fools Event is a brand new temporary campaign with a single adventure and three variants. You can start the adventures from the Campaign Map just like you would any other adventure, except that you must spend Event Tokens (Pennants) to start them. The base adventure will unlock a new Champion, and the variants and free play provide chests that can be used to gear up the Champion. When the event ends, you keep the new Champion, any gear you have aquired for them, and a gain a boost to your permanent campaign favor. How do I get more Event Tokens (Pennants)? Event Tokens will drop periodically from monsters in all adventures and campaigns. You will also receive Event Tokens along with your offline gold gains when you load the game after having been offline for a while. Finally, using Contracts during the event will award Event Tokens at a rate of 2 per minute (60 for small contracts, 480 for medium, and 960 for large). How do I use the new Champion I've unlocked? Once you complete the event's base adventure, you can swap in the new Champion you've unlocked by clicking on the portrait of whomever they swap with, then clicking the swap button the top-right corner of their portrait on their character sheet. You can only have one Champion from each bench slot in your formation at a time. How do I gear up the new Champion I've unlocked? Equipment for event champions appear in event-specific chests. They cannot receive gear from normal silver or gold chests. You can earn event chests by completing event variants, the event free play, or by purchasing them directly for Event Tokens. Why is the Divine Favor in the event different from the base campaign Divine Favor? In order to provide a more balanced experience for all players, each event has a different type of Divine Favor, which means everyone starts on relatively even footing. You still have your gear, unlocked Champions, and experience with formations to give you an advantage over newer players. What happens to my Event Divine Favor after the event ends? Once the event ends you'll have an opportunity to convert your Event Divine Favor into a different deity's Divine Favor for the campaign of your choice, so your hard earned Event Divine Favor will not go to waste. The more Divine Favor you earn in the event, the bigger the amount you earn for your permanent campaign.

How do I play the Littlefoot's Big Adventure Event? The Littlefoot's Big Adventure Event is a limited-time campaign with five objectives and free play. You must do a soft reset or abandon your current objective to play them. To do a soft reset, level Nate Dragon (the 20th Crusader) up to level 150 and use his "Reset the World" ability (if this is your first time playing that will take between 1 to 3 days on average). The first objective costs 100 event currency to begin, so make sure you have some saved up before you reset. How do I get more Marshmallows? Event currency will drop from monsters at a fairly regular rate in any objective. They are also awarded based on an averaged drop rate when you use Warp cards. You can save up your event currency and do a bunch of event Objectives in a row, so don't worry if you're a few days away from resetting when the event begins. I unlocked the new Crusaders, but I can't find them to put in my formation! Ranger Rayna and Littlefoot can replace the Princess and Thalia, the Thunder King on your bench and in your formation. Look for the swap button next to the level-up button on the Princess or Thalia to swap them. You can only have one Crusader from each bench seat in your formation at a time. Will the event Crusaders stick around after the event ends? Yes, as long as you unlock the event Crusaders (or are on the objective to unlock the second one) before the event ends, you'll be able to swap them into your formation at any time. How do I get equipment for the event Crusaders? Equipment cards for event Crusaders can only be found in event chests, which can be earned by completing event objectives, event free play, or by purchasing them from the store. Jeweled Event Chests will be awarded from completing the 'Lost in the Woods', 'Number One Threat', and 'Long Journey' objectives, and additional event chests can be earned by doing event Free Play. Event chests will remain available in the in-game store for 2 days following the end of the event, but you are only able to buy them for event currency while the event is still running. What happens if the event ends while I'm still doing an Event Objective or Free Play? You will be able to finish up that event objective or free play and earn the full rewards even if you don't finish until after the event ends. This includes permanently unlocking an Event Crusader if that's the particular objective you're on.

attack_defines.description: Birdsong leaps out with a cat's grace and attacks her enemies with her sword.

attack_defines.description: Zorbu fires a bolt from his massive crossbow at a random enemy, dealing damage to all.
attack_defines.name: Massive Bolt

attack_defines.long_description: Zorbu winds up a small mechanical squirrel and sends it skittering towards a random enemy. When it reaches them, it detonates the hidden vial of Alchemist's fire inside, and does AOE damage to all nearby enemies.
attack_defines.description: Zorbu winds up a small mechanical squirrel and sends it skittering towards a random enemy.
attack_defines.name: Mechanical Squirrel

attack_defines.description: Strix throws a fireball at a random enemy, dealing a small amount of aoe damage.
attack_defines.name: Fireball

attack_defines.long_description: Strix's staff polymorphs into a pie plate, an owlbear plushy, or a flying broom, and changes her base attack for a brief period of time.
attack_defines.description: Strix's staff polymorphs into a random object, changing the way she attacks for a brief period.
attack_defines.name: Polymorph Staff

attack_defines.long_description: Strix attacks with her Flame Blade pie plate dealing 5x the damage of her regular attacking, and hitting a nearby enemy with that same damage as well
attack_defines.description: Strix attacks with her Flame Blade pie plate, hitting a nearby enemy as well
attack_defines.name: Pie Plate Punch

attack_defines.long_description: Strix's Owlbear companion, Waffles, attacks in her stead. Waffles starts doing 3x Strix's damage, and does 2x the damage each attack for 5 attacks.
attack_defines.description: Waffles attacks in Strix's stead, become more enraged with each attack
attack_defines.name: Waffles Whack

attack_defines.description: Strix throws a fireball at a random enemy, dealing a small amount of aoe damage.

attack_defines.description: Nrakk attacks the nearest enemy with his Kensei Naginata.
attack_defines.name: Kensei Weapon

attack_defines.long_description: Nrakk channels Ki into his Naginata, increasing the damage dealt by all of his attacks by $(nrakk_ult_buffed 200)% for the next 30 seconds.
attack_defines.description: Nrakk channels Ki into his Naginata, increasing the damage dealt by all of his attacks.

attack_defines.description: Catti-brie shoots the farthest enemy with her bow
attack_defines.name: Long Shot

attack_defines.long_description: Catti-Brie shoots six arrows at once from her bow. Each enemy hit by her arrows can be crit by all Champions using Catti-brie's crit chance and damage bonus for 30 seconds.
attack_defines.description: Catti-Brie shoots six arrows at once from her bow, making each enemy hit more vulnerable for 30 seconds.
attack_defines.name: Empty the Quiver
